Language.Sentence: The Form dropdown list type produces an object displayed as a drop-down list. It can be contained only in the Form and Container objects. The data to display must be written in the 'Value' attribute separated by logical slashes (|) and the same number of identifiers of these values must be written in the 'Value ID' attribute separated by logical slashes (|).
Order of rendering the object on the page
Spacing between the top edge of the container and the object in pixels
Spacing between the left edge of the container and the object in pixels
Width of the object in pixels
Height of the object in pixels
String of displayed values, separated by '|'
String of identifying values, separated by '|'
Index of selected value in list (from 0)
Index number of switching the elements on pressing the tab key
Define the selection mode, that is the number of selected values
Position in visual hierarchy of objects
Incorrect value, must be even integer from 0 to 99
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer
Incorrect value, must be either 0 or 1
Incorrect value, must be even integer from 0 to 99
Incorrect value, must be either 0 or 1

Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds

Valeur Incorrecte, doit être compris entre 0 et 99

Расстояние от верхней границы родительского контейнера до объекта в пикселях

Type.SourceCode:
import StringIO
class VDOM_formdropdown(VDOM_object):
def check_unit(self, value): return value + "px" if value.isdigit() else value
def render(self, contents=""): display = u"none" if self.visible == "0" else self.displaying zindex = self.zindex if int(self.zindex) != 0 else u"" position = self.positioning if self.positioning and self.positioning != "static" else u""
styles = { "width": self.check_unit(self.width), "height": self.check_unit(self.height), "margin": self.margins, "padding": self.paddings, "top": self.check_unit(self.top), "left": self.check_unit(self.left), "position": position, "display": display, "font-size": "%s" % self.check_unit(self.fontsize) or None, "font-family": "%s" % self.fontfamily.replace('"', "'") or None, "z-index": zindex } if self.positioning == "static": styles["top"] = styles["left"] = ""
style = " ".join(["{}: {};".format(key, value) for key, value in styles.items() if value])
id = u"o_" + (self.id).replace('-', '_') size_attr = u"""size="%s" """ % self.size if self.size else u""
classname = u"""class='%s'""" % ' '.join([self.classname, 'vdom_formdropdown']).strip()
if self.multiselect and self.multiselect == "1": multiselect_attr = u"""multiselect="1" """ else: multiselect_attr = u""
select = u"""<select id="{id}" name="{name}" tabindex="{tabind}" {size} {multisel} style="{style}" {classname}> """.format(id = id, name = self.name, tabind = self.tabindex, size = size_attr, multisel = multiselect_attr, style = style, classname = classname)
if not self.value: self.value = self.value1
list = self.value.split("|") list1 = self.value1.split("|") if len(list) != len(list1): return u""
res_buffer = StringIO.StringIO(u"") res_buffer.write(select)
for idx in xrange(len(list1)): if unicode(list1[idx]) == unicode(self.selectedvalue): selected = u"""selected="selected" """ else: selected = u"" option = u"""<option value="{cur_value}" {selected}>{cur_item}</option>"""\ .format(cur_value = list1[idx], selected = selected, cur_item = list[idx]) res_buffer.write(option)
res_buffer.write(u"</select>") result = res_buffer.getvalue() res_buffer.close() return result
def wysiwyg(self, contents=""): width, height, top, left = [int(self.ide_width), int(self.ide_height), int(self.ide_top), int(self.ide_left)]
result = \ u"""<container name="{name}" id="{id}" visible="{vis}" zindex="{zind}" hierarchy="{hierarchy}" order="{order}" top="{top}" left="{left}" width="{width}" height="{height}"> <svg> <rect y="{out_top}" x="{out_left}" width="{out_wid}" height="{out_hei}" fill="#FFFFFF" stroke="#000000"/> </svg>{contents} <svg> <rect x="{inn_left}" y="{inn_top}" width="{inn_wid}" height="{inn_hei}" fill="#EEEEEE" stroke="#000000"/> <polygon fill="black" stroke="#000000" points="{xa},{ya} {xb},{yb} {xc},{yc}"/> </svg> </container> """.format(id = self.id, vis = self.visible, zind = self.zindex, name = self.name, hierarchy = self.hierarchy, order = self.order, top = top, left = left, width = width, height = height, out_top = 0, out_left = 0, out_wid = width-1, out_hei = height-1, contents = contents, inn_left = width-14, inn_top = 0, inn_wid = 14, inn_hei = height-1, xa = width-9, ya = height / 2 - 3, xb = width-5, yb = height / 2 - 3, xc = width-7, yc = height / 2 + 3)
return VDOM_object.wysiwyg(self, contents=result)
def on_update(object, attributes): o = object mods = {}
for attr in ["left", "width", "height", "top"]: if attr in attributes: attr_value = attributes[attr] obj_value = o.attributes.get(attr, '').lower()
if obj_value.isdigit() and attr_value.isdigit(): mods[attr] = attr_value + "px" mods["ide_"+ attr] = attr_value elif obj_value.endswith("px") and (attr_value.isdigit() or "px" in attr_value): mods[attr] = attr_value.rstrip("px") + "px" mods["ide_"+ attr] = attr_value.rstrip("px") elif attr_value.isdigit() or "px" in attr_value: mods[attr] = attr_value if "px" in attr_value else obj_value mods["ide_"+ attr] = attr_value.rstrip("px") else: mods[attr] = attr_value attributes.update(mods)
users = """ #%(id)s {
} """ skin_mapping = { "0": users, "1": "" } # if "skin" in attributes: # skin = attributes["skin"] # if skin in skin_mapping: # attributes.update(style=skin_mapping[skin]) # else: # attributes.update(skin="0") # if "style" in attributes and attributes.get("style") not in skin_mapping.values(): # attributes.update(skin="0")
return ""
def on_compile(object, attributes): for attr in ["left", "width", "height", "top"]: obj_value = object.attributes[attr]
if obj_value.isdigit() or "px" in obj_value: object.attributes[attr] = obj_value.rstrip("px") + "px" object.attributes["ide_"+ attr] = obj_value.rstrip("px")
